strategy: Use CatBoost with the following settings: iterations=500, learning_rate=0.03, depth=6. For preprocessing, fill numeric NaN values with the median and drop columns with more than 50% missing values. Do not use get_dummies; instead, pass categorical features directly to CatBoost using the cat_features parameter. If you encounter a dtype error, cast categorical columns to strings before training.

actions.action:
cat << 'ENDOFFILE' > train_and_predict.py
import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
from catboost import CatBoostRegressor

# Load data
train = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
validation = pd.read_csv('data/validation.csv')
test = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Define target
target = 'SalePrice'

# Drop columns with more than 50% missing values
threshold = 0.5
missing_ratio = train.isnull().mean()
cols_to_drop = missing_ratio[missing_ratio > threshold].index
train = train.drop(columns=cols_to_drop)
validation = validation.drop(columns=cols_to_drop)
test = test.drop(columns=cols_to_drop)

# Fill numeric NaN with median
numeric_columns = train.select_dtypes(include=[np.number]).columns
train[numeric_columns] = train[numeric_columns].fillna(train[numeric_columns].median())
validation[numeric_columns] = validation[numeric_columns].fillna(validation[numeric_columns].median())
test[numeric_columns] = test[numeric_columns].fillna(test[numeric_columns].median())

# Convert categorical columns to string to avoid dtype errors
categorical_columns = train.select_dtypes(include=['object']).columns
for col in categorical_columns:
    train[col] = train[col].astype(str)
    validation[col] = validation[col].astype(str)
    test[col] = test[col].astype(str)

# Identify categorical features for CatBoost
cat_features = train.select_dtypes(include=['object']).columns.tolist()

# Prepare features and target
X_train = train.drop(columns=[target])
y_train = train[target]
X_val = validation.drop(columns=[target])
y_val = validation[target]

# Initialize and train CatBoost model
model = CatBoostRegressor(
    iterations=500,
    learning_rate=0.03,
    depth=6,
    verbose=False
)

model.fit(X_train, y_train, cat_features=cat_features, eval_set=[(X_val, y_val)])

# Predict on test set
X_test = test.drop(columns=['Id'])
test_predictions = model.predict(X_test)

# Create submission
submission = pd.DataFrame({
    'Id': test['Id'],
    'SalePrice': test_predictions
})

submission.to_csv('submissi

import numpy as np
from catboost import CatBoostRegressor

# Load data
train = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
validation = pd.read_csv('data/validation.csv')
test = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

target = 'SalePrice'

import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
from catboost import CatBoostRegressor

# Load data
train = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
validation = pd.read_csv('data/validation.csv')
test = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Define target
target = 'SalePrice'

# Drop columns with more than 50% missing values
threshold = 0.5
missing_ratio = train.isnull().mean()
cols_to_drop = missing_ratio[missing_ratio > threshold].index
train = train.drop(columns=cols_to_drop)
validation = validation.drop(columns=cols_to_drop)
test = test.drop(columns=cols_to_drop)

# Fill numeric NaN with median
numeric_columns = train.select_dtypes(include=[np.number]).columns
# Remove target from numeric columns
numeric_columns = numeric_columns[numeric_columns != target]
train[numeric_columns] = train[numeric_columns].fillna(train[numeric_columns].median())
validation[numeric_columns] = validation[numeric_columns].fillna(validation[numeric_columns].median())
test[numeric_columns] = test[numeric_columns].fillna(test[numeric_columns].median())

# Convert categorical columns to string to avoid dtype errors
categorical_columns = train.select_dtypes(include=['object']).columns
for col in categorical_columns:
    train[col] = train[col].astype(str)
    validation[col] = validation[col].astype(str)
    test[col] = test[col].astype(str)

# Identify categorical features for CatBoost
cat_features = train.select_dtypes(include=['object']).columns.tolist()

# Ensure cat_features indices are valid and within column bounds
cat_features = [col for col in cat_features if col in train.columns]

# If no valid categorical features, set empty list
if not cat_features:
    cat_features = []

# Prepare features and target
X_train = train.drop(columns=[target])
y_train = train[target]
X_val = validation.drop(columns=[target])
y_val = validation[target]
